tripleplay.game.trans

Class SlideTransition

  • java.lang.Object
    • tripleplay.game.trans.AbstractTransition<T>
      • tripleplay.game.trans.InterpedTransition<SlideTransition>
        • tripleplay.game.trans.SlideTransition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ScreenStack.Transition

    public class SlideTransition
extends InterpedTransition<SlideTransition>
    Slides the old screen off, and the new screen on right behind.

      • init

        public void init(Screen oscreen,
                 Screen nscreen)
        Description copied from interface: ScreenStack.Transition
        Allows the transition to pre-compute useful values. This will immediately be followed by call to ScreenStack.Transition.update(tripleplay.game.Screen, tripleplay.game.Screen, float) with an elapsed time of zero.
        Specified by:
        init in interface ScreenStack.Transition
        Overrides:
        init in class AbstractTransition<SlideTransition>

      • update

        public boolean update(Screen oscreen,
                      Screen nscreen,
                      float elapsed)
        Description copied from interface: ScreenStack.Transition
        Called every frame to update the transition
        Parameters:
        oscreen - the outgoing screen.
        nscreen - the incoming screen.
        elapsed - the elapsed time since the transition started (in millis if that's what your game is sending to ScreenStack.update(int)).
        Returns:
        false if the transition is not yet complete, true when it is complete.

      • complete

        public void complete(Screen oscreen,
                     Screen nscreen)
        Description copied from interface: ScreenStack.Transition
        Called when the transition is complete. This is where the transition should clean up any temporary bits and restore the screens to their original state. The stack will automatically destroy/hide the old screen after calling this method. Also note that this method may be called before the transition signals completion, if a new transition is started and this transition needs be aborted.
        Specified by:
        complete in interface ScreenStack.Transition
        Overrides:
        complete in class AbstractTransition<SlideTransition>
